snippet: The official leading the inquiry in Switzerland said about nine terabytes of data had been seized during a sweep of the Zurich offices of world soccer’s governing body.
abstract: Prosecutor Michael Lauber, who is leading Switzerland’s investigation into activities of FIFA, world soccer's governing body, says inquiry will include examination of more than 50 suspicious financial relationships.
lead_paragraph: The official leading the inquiry in Switzerland said about nine terabytes of data had been seized during a sweep of the Zurich offices of world soccer’s governing body.

headline.main: Suspicious Swiss Bank Deals to Be Part of FIFA Investigation
headline.print_headline: Swiss Prosecutor Details Scope of FIFA Inquiry
